title: Let us input our own workout info
text: It‚Äôs not bad but we should be able to put in my own work out information as it‚Äôs always super off and wrong! It makes 0 sense

title: Calories Burned üî•
text: Great App, enjoy how simple it is and that it tracks hydration. The only reason I didn‚Äôt give 5 stars is because the calories burn is incorrect and I‚Äôm not sure how it calculates. If pulls from my watch it should match.. example run this morning burn 619cal this app saves it 570 .. that‚Äôs a big difference. Fingers crossed it will be fixed soon

title: Decent Tracker but Updated UI Is Terrible
text:
I would rate this app 5/5 because it is extremely helpful and decently accurate (though it could be better) but holy cow the new interface is so bad that it forced me to write this review (I have never left a review for anything). Specifically the UI when logging what you ate from your saved data. It is sorted alphabetically now which is a plus but between the keyboard showing up by default and the new navigation in general it is not very user friendly. It is also laggy and inconvenient.

Also huge L on the daily streak system. It is not a huge deal but I am salty that I lost my 130 day streak due to a bug? (I log daily religiously, so I assume it was a bug).

title: Not free
text: Not actually free

title: This app does not disappoint
text: So often you get an app and quickly delete it  because it doesn‚Äôt deliver. This is the real deal and the easiest user friendly app I have ever used for calories. Will have it forever.

title: Amazing features, simple UI, and a fair price if you got it at $20/yr like myself
text:
Let me start off by saying that I‚Äôve used macro tracking apps for many years. I used a competitor app religiously. This app has great features, isn‚Äôt bloated with nonsense, is simple to use, and affordable. I hope the developers continue to improve it though as it‚Äôs not without its flaws and does leave some to be desired.

Areas where there are some room for improvement:

Accuracy - there are times when I‚Äôm logging a food manually and switch from ounces to grams when I noticed the outcomes of the macros are not the same despite them equaling the same weight.

Planning - I don‚Äôt need anything fancy here, but I would love to be able to click on the next day and plan a some of my meals.

Serving sizes - there are times when I use the search feature to find a food only to discover that I‚Äôm not able to use gram, ounces, cups or really any measurements other than the ‚Äústandard‚Äù serving size. However, with these pre-logged food items it‚Äôs not clear how much the serving size is nor is it even listed.

Calories burned - when toggling this feature on it adds to your daily calories based on what you‚Äôve burned that day. However, it‚Äôll tell you that you have more calories that you can eat, but it does not calculate what that should translate to in macros.

title: Worst $30 Ever Spent
text: Who are the people giving this app 5 Stars???  Cal AI is the worst app I‚Äôve ever downloaded let alone paid for. Just one example of many; this evening I had a cobia fillet with asparagus for dinner, per Cal AI I consumed; 6240 cal, 888g protein, 286g of fat, and 15 carbs. Yeah, right!  Won‚Äôt be worrying about Apple AI taking over the world.

title: Do not buy/subscribe to this app
text:
The app does an accurate job of calculating your macros based off of the BMR algorithm. However if you want to change your macros to fit your diet it does not accurately change the total calories based off of changing my individual macros. The customer service team was quick to respond but has not resolved the issue and will not issue a refund as requested due to a malfunctioning app. 

*update no refund will be provided final decision

title: Charged Me Even Though I Deactivated My Account
text: I signed up for the free trial.  I ended up deciding to not move forward with the paid subscription.   The paid subscription was set to take effect on 2/27/25. I deactivated and deleted my account on 2/26/25 and was still charged the full year subscription fee on 2/27/25 despite my account being deactivated on 2/26/25.  I have been refused a refund.

title: Won‚Äôt let me have my $30 refund
text: I tried the free trial for a couple days and I forgot to cancel my subscription. I went and spoke to customer service from this app , and see if they could help me issue a refund and they refuse to and they had sent me straight to  Apple services to request a refund and they won‚Äôt let me get a refund. Disgusting people out here stealing peoples money. I‚Äôll report to FTC

title: Good app, but‚Ä¶.
text: Good app, but the calories burned counter for workouts is inaccurate and inconsistent. I have entered that I did 50 pushups and it will say I burned 50 calories, then I have entered 100 pushups then it says I have burned the same amount of calories as doing 50 pushups.

title: small complaints
text: just do to small bugs that are really annoying like the app timing out and not letting you select anything, sometimes you have to refresh the app 3+ times. There are other small critiques such as if you use the barcode scanner it will say you at the whole thing depending on the product. lol. but the funniest one is it says I‚Äôm over weight but little does it know I have abs‚Ä¶üòÇ

title: Amazing
text: This is the only calorie tracker that I found that Greg‚Äôs my douccette it allows you to save food and save meals so you don‚Äôt have to go in and manually put in what you eat every time.(Mike isratel lat spread)(fart noise)It‚Äôs very nice overall I‚Äôm down 10 pounds in a week and a half. Thank you Greg

title: Cannot log in
text: I purchased the app online. Downloaded and attempted to sign in. I keep receiving an error message that they cannot find my subscription. When I reached out to support, they keep telling me the data is stored within the device and not a traditional log in. I‚Äôm using the same device and still not able to log in. I have tried everything. They will not honor a refund. $36.99 down the drain.

title: Sharp
text: Sharp

title: Needs Updates
text:
This app is minimal -  it‚Äôs not a bad thing but it‚Äôs usefulness is limited to deciding whether you should eat more today. 

Things that annoy me about this:

1. You can only log food for the current day. If you forgot to log something, you can‚Äôt go back the following day and add it.

2. You can‚Äôt really tell whether your improving anything over the long run, only whether you hit your daily calorie goal or not. The only analytics you have access to are:
- Calories you logged each day for the previous 4 weeks
- Calories & macros you logged today
You cannot see your macros for any day other than the day you log them.

3. You can‚Äôt export your data - if it‚Äôs going to delete your data after 4 weeks anyway, this would be nice have.

Overall, you can‚Äôt do any sort of planning with this but it‚Äôs useful to remind yourself to eat more or less.

title: Baja
text: Bah

title: Cannot transfer the subscription to new device
text: I got a second phone as a upgrade.  I had a paid subscription on my original device. I went to activate my new phone and tried to activate the Cal Ai subscription and it didn't work. Reached out to support and they have informed me a subscription is tied to a device. So getting a new phone, I will need to pay AGAIN for the subscription. Lost or stolen phone? Pay again for the subscription. Literally stealing money via subscriptions.

title: Cal Al review
text: I like the app, however I wish I could personalize it more. I have my weight loss goals, but I'm still breast feeding, so I need a balance of consuming the right amount of calories & being able to obtain my weight losss goals.

title: Disappointing AI
text: The app doesn‚Äôt fulfill its promises on taking pictures and having AI break down the food product and cals. Very disappointed after paying for a year ‚Äî If you accept their discounted year, you no longer have a trial period. I don‚Äôt suggest this app.

title: Can‚Äôt log back in
text: Paid for a year subscription, got a new phone now they can‚Äôt find my subscription. Done.

title: Not very accurate. Expensive.
text: This app was pretty expensive especially with how inaccurate everything is.

title: Ai feature cool but lacks calorie tracking
text: The Ai feature is cool but other apps have this. There is no where to add the calories you burned from a tracker like Apple Watch.

title: Want my account back!
text: I‚Äôve been using this app and I really liked it however the app was accidentally deleted but I did not cancel my subscription. I downloaded the app back and I cannot get into the same account with the same perks that I paid for! It‚Äôs telling me that I did not make a purchase and cannot find my account please fix this!

title: Great
text: Great app to lose weight

title: Charged me even tho I canceled.
text: Garbage app that just asks chat gpt what it thinks of ur pictures. Not clever in the slightest. And they took money from me even though I canceled my subscription on the second day. Don‚Äôt download this garbage.

title: Worst support paid and app does not work.
text: Paid for the app. App shows expired.  Sent 20 support emails. No help at all. Don‚Äôt spend money on this unless you want to lose it.  The support team keeps sending me the same email.  My next review I will include the email.  Horrible experience stay away from this app.

title: the app is decent BUT
text: The app is alright it gets the calories and nutrient info correct sometimes but most of the time not, i suggest just taking a picture of the cal and nutrient info on the label for it to work the best. The only real problem which is one that i always have with these apps is that they say 80% of overall subscription which is like $1-2 and i would be fine with that per month but it wants to charge you for the whole year up front and im not up for it. thanks though.

title: Money Grab
text: Money Grab company I cancelled my free trial and was still charged 32.46. I‚Äôm livid

title: Not free
text: Not free

title: No ability to add fitness tracker
text: I wish I could log my steps. I think it would increase the accuracy, especially since I do between 15 and 20000/day

title: AI suggestion vs actual calories
text: Weighing the food out to calculate actual calories vs the AI suggestion from photos can yield significantly different results, I‚Äôve seen the AI under and over estimate calories  by 500+. ‚ÄúFix results‚Äù is also enormously flawed and seems to have a very limited number of responses it can act on.

title: Dishonest Company
text: I‚Äôve already emailed this publisher about their dishonest business strategies. This publisher REQUIRES you to leave them a FIVE STAR review before you‚Äôre allowed to complete the sign up process. They‚Äôve even gone as far as to remove the option to leave anything less than five stars. How is anyone supposed to leave an honest review when they‚Äôve not even been given the chance to use the app. I don‚Äôt work with companies that make this kind of shady/dishonest business strategy their pathway to success.

title: Issues
text: Says I cancelled my subscription and i did not, now theres a widget in middle of dashboard asking me to renew. Renew for what? My subscription is good until September. Support just keeps suggesting the same things which aren‚Äôt correcting the problem.  No thanks. So frustrating! Just downloaded and paid for Macrofactor

title: Subscription is a scam
text: I signed up for the free trial. Decided I wanted to cancel it the next day. Wasn‚Äôt an option to do in the app so I looked it up and came across the website. However, it would not send me the email to cancel it, seemed like a decoy. I deleted my account but wanted to be sure so I went through Apple setting and looked at subscriptions and it was still gonna charge me for the year. Double double check that your subscription is cancelledüëç

title: 3 Stars
text: App is okay. I gave it three stars because it needs some more adjustments. For one the subscription I feel like it‚Äôs a little too much. The second thing is the scanning of the food. I feel like sometimes it‚Äôs off if I scan something that‚Äôs pretty common on every app like a ‚Äúpastry‚Äù or a dish that‚Äôs very common like Cuban food. Sometimes it just doesn‚Äôt grasp the full ingredients from the pics and that needs improvements. Also as someone who like to have everything in the health app, the integration to the health app would be great and make things a lot more convenient for everyone. Another thing would be the water settings, have like a water feature where you remind the person to drink their desired goal of water to drink everyday. This would remind and motivate those to actually drink water. Also I think they should add a feature where it calculates the works out you do. Currently it takes steps you do, but that‚Äôs just not enough. There‚Äôs so much potential with this app, 3 stars is where I feel like it‚Äôs at for me.

title: Accuracy
text: Terrible experience. I would like a refund, but I read that it‚Äôs not possible. For example, try recognizing a glass of apple juice. It will most likely be identified as orange juice. Then press ‚ÄúFix result‚Äù and specify that it‚Äôs Simply Apple juice. As a result, it will always show 0 calories, and you can‚Äôt change it in that entry. There are plenty of similar examples. Moreover, even though I granted access to Apple Health, the app hasn‚Äôt recorded anything there for several days. Support didn‚Äôt solve the issue and just disappeared. I strongly do not recommend it. It doesn‚Äôt work.

title: Do not purchase through website
text: I made a 3month purchase through instagram to be able to use the app. Once I paid, I was sent an email with a link to download the app. After downloading, I could not log on as I got an error that I had not made a purchase. Long story short 14 emails later the only thing their ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äù could do for me is tell me to wait until my subscription expires and pay for another one. No refund. No linking my account so I can use what I already paid for. They‚Äôll be keeping my $40 while I have 0 access. What a joke.

title: A let down
text: I thought the app was going to have a lot of promise but there are just too many issues. No measurements in sugar sodium or fiber, the bar code is iffy, the food library is ridiculous to navigate. I thought the barcode scanner would be great but it doesnt work on majority of the things I scan. I tried to scan a box, take a picture of the food label, and then search it. Got all different readings - its not reliable. I just wish I realized that before the free trial had expired

title: Terribly inaccurate
text: You see the reviews of it online looks like it would be useful if it actually worked. For everything I scanned it was off anywhere between 300-600 calories. About 30-50% LESS calories than what was actually in the meals. I requested a refund for the year subscription because the app is actually useless. If you use this and rely on photos you will gain weight. Unless you‚Äôre eating pre packed meals that the ai can get correct.

title: Concerned about accuracy of goals
text: I (M31) am about 145 pounds, 5‚Äô11 and workout 4 times a week. The app is telling me in order to gain 60 pounds in about 3 months, I only need to eat 2,444 calories a day. I wish!! My maintenance should be somewhere around 2,500, so to GAIN that much I need at least 1k more. Developers should look into this as it dramatically reduces the value of the app.

title: Awesome but missing a few things
text:
I love this app. I had food noms before and this is quite a bit faster to get food in but Foodnoms & my fitness pal have way better data. 

A few wishes:

1. Better apple health syncing. It should pull my height and weight from there automatically if I add an entry.

2. Better ‚Äústandard‚Äù foods. Common foods like whole milk, eggs, and white bread (to name a few) are horribly off in the macros. Sometimes it‚Äôll have whole milk show up as 150 cal and 0 protein for a glass. Other times it‚Äôll show as 300 cal and 25 grams of protein. I wish instead of AI trying to calculate this every time It would just pull from a known database.

3. Macros analytics. I can only really view analytics like average calorie intake over weeks/months, but not protein, fats, etc. I wish we had these to view.

title: Just needs apple health integration
text: This is a cool app that works reasonably well. The one thing it‚Äôs missing is proper Apple health integration. I wish it would write the caloric and nutritional content in addition to reading caloric burn

title: This is app is godly
text: This app is great! I don‚Äôt typically go out of my way to rate an app but this one is getting a review. I‚Äôve been working out for over a year and a half now. I set out to change my life a year and a half ago. I successfully did that. I lost over 100 pounds not counting macros. I wanted to start tracking my macros so I can lose the last 40 pounds of my goal. I got stuck at my weight for two months I couldn‚Äôt move the scale. I got this app it made me truly focus on my macros. I finally pushed through the hump because of this application. It is fairly priced at $30 a year as well. I recommend this!

title: This is the future, but‚Ä¶ misses polish for ‚Äúboring fundamentals‚Äù
text:
This app is certainly the future. The completion like my fitness pal and the likes lose on both cumbersome UI and having worse AI model doing the calorie estimates. Clearly the form factor of this cal ai much better.

There are however little things that need improvement:
- when ai model fails it displays a WiFi error instead
- kilograms need more granularity maybe 0.5 like pounds
- database sometimes has error eg some Perrier zero registers as nonzero calories 

Obviously it takes work to polish this long tail of little things. Keep up the good work for 5 star review in the future!

title: Simple and easy
text:
I never write reviews, but every time I open this app I get a little frustrated. I love how simple it is to track calories, and I love more that I can look up brands or just snap a picture, but this app could definitely be more simple. 

As someone who repeats meals often, it‚Äôs so frustrating to have to type, or search, or save a food every time. Even in the ‚Äúsaved foods‚Äù section, there‚Äôs a lot of steps and scrolling needed to find what I‚Äôm looking for. This app would make things easier if it didn‚Äôt feel like such a chore to log my food with so many buttons and scrolling. 

Is this app simple to use? Yes. But after I‚Äôve spent so much time logging macros, or on a day I‚Äôm too hungry to count calories, the extra steps it takes to find my previous recipe is sooo tedious.

title: Fraud

title: Not user friendly
text: I found this app to be less user-friendly compared to other tracking apps I've used. It lacks many features that would enhance the experience, and it doesn‚Äôt separate meals into categories like breakfast, lunch, and dinner, which I think is essential for better tracking. Additionally, it would be great to see my goals and daily achievements highlighted on the main login page for easier access. Overall, it has potential, but it needs improvements to be more effective.

title: It‚Äôs Ok
text: It‚Äôs basically a normal calorie counter, and there are a lot of free ones that would be better than this one. A few good things about this app is it syncs with Apple health and fitness. It also is an easy platform to manage. The downside is the AI and barcode are not always correct, and most of the time you need to manually input your macros. It‚Äôs also faulty with carbs and fat. It will count the total amount for both without considering differences like how much fiber or unsaturated fat there is. I wish it had a more broad spectrum and the AI was better. I think if they can figure out the kinks it would be a phenomenal app.

title: Terrible
text: Overall this app is terrible.  It‚Äôs not intuitive.  You have to input most of the data.  It also solely considers the BMI as the tool to determine if you‚Äôre overweight.  Do not buy this app thinking you are getting a deal @ $19.99 for the year.  Save your money and buy the My Fitness Pal app instead.  It has the built in AI feature in its premium content.  I have extreme buyer‚Äôs remorse because I decided to go ahead and purchase the year membership for $19.99 before doing the free trial because the app said that was only time it would be available for that price.

title: Calorie tracker not accurate
text:
I discovered that there may be a problem with the calculation for counting calories. 

When you initially input your goals it asks you how often you workout and uses that to calculate what your caloric intake should be. 

There is also an option to input a workout or have your phones Health activity capture your workouts which would double count calories burned. 

While you do have to tap the slider to have your workouts captured apply against your caloric intake, I believe there is an opportunity to make that slider be inactive if you have already chosen your goal is to lose weight and provided an input for your weekly workout routine. 

Aside from that I‚Äôve really enjoyed the app so far.

title: Not all features created equal
text:
So far best ai picture to calorie app I‚Äôve found. BUT the barcode scanner feature failed me 2x today, which is day two of my free trial. It couldn‚Äôt find one item and mismatched the other item completely. Items were flying by Jin sauce and immi ramen. Immi is very popular in fitness and flying by Jin is one of the most US mainstream chili crisps today. It‚Äôs sold at Costco even. I worry about what else it won‚Äôt be able to find. 
Barcode scanning is non negotiable, especially on a paid calorie tracking app. Going to cancel my subscription for now because just doesn‚Äôt make sense. I hope to see it improve in the future and then maybe I can come back. There was a lot to like about it and think it has potential. If it was free I might keep it. Maybe they should offer a free version or tiered so they can get more barcode data to improve their app

title: Needs better accuracy
text:
Just from my general knowledge and experience counting macros in the past, snapping the picture of the food is cool. It just doesn‚Äôt get the portions right. It will something‚Äôs thing it‚Äôs 1000 Calorie meal when in reality it‚Äôs closer to 500 or a 500 calorie meal when it‚Äôs closer to 1000. The good thing is you can type in and adjust as you see fit but this would be hard to do for a beginner counting macros. 

Also, it says it has the option to connect to apple health. I‚Äôve tried over and over again and no luck. 3 stars until these issues are fixed.

title: Inaccurate Tracking
text: The photo feature is a nice gimmick to lure you in but it's not practical if you want to actually track your meals. Using the bar code scanner is a worse version of MyFitnessPal. Truly one of the worst apps I have ever used and you will gain a lot of weight using this app.
